## Description {#details}

Class which can be overriden by targets to modify the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/instruction">mca::Instruction</a> objects before the pipeline starts.

A common usage of this class is to add immediate operands to certain instructions or to remove Defs/Uses from an instruction where the schedulinng model is incorrect.

Definition at line 36 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mca/custombehaviour-h">CustomBehaviour.h</a>.

## Public Member Functions

### postProcessInstruction() {#a0aebc085377df021eeab8e14dd58d6b0}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual void llvm::mca::InstrPostProcess::postProcessInstruction (std::unique&#95;ptr&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/instruction">Instruction</a> &gt; &amp; Inst, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcinst">MCInst</a> &amp; MCI)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
This method can be overriden by targets to modify the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/instruction">mca::Instruction</a> object after it has been lowered from the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcinst">MCInst</a>.

This is generally a less disruptive alternative to modifying the scheduling model.
